meanings.definition: The act of attributing or ascribing something to someone.
meanings.sent1: Her imputations of success to her hard work motivated her to keep going.
meanings.sent2: The imputations of blame on the innocent person were unfair.
meanings.sent3: The imputations of magic powers to the cat made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The imputations of wisdom to the old tree were whispered among the villagers.
meanings.sent5: The imputations of bravery to the small mouse inspired the other animals.

meanings.sent1: The imputations of theft on the student were proven false.
meanings.sent2: She felt hurt by the imputations of dishonesty made against her.
meanings.sent3: The imputations of laziness on the hardworking bee seemed ridiculous.
meanings.sent4: The imputations of betrayal on the loyal dog were quickly dismissed.
meanings.sent5: The imputations of greed on the generous donor were completely unfounded.
